page.title: 05SHOTESHAM/HOWE FARM 2 STOCK
page.content:
Most mixed arable farms in the area also have{CATTLE}or a suckling herd. Calves are reared as store bullocks,18 months old, and 'fats', 2 year old calves, and sold. Store bullocks are grazed on Shotesham common.
{OTHER LIVESTOCK}kept in the area_ Cockerels, in all stages of growth, are reared free_range on 6_7 acres. Eggs are produced in Battery houses. Pigs are kept for pork production. Ducks are farmed by Brooders. They are bought in at 1 day old. They need to be vaccinated and to sterilise their brood. They are kept until 3.5 weeks old, the last 5 days being spent out on grass depending on the weather. The ducks are then sent out of the area to the Fatteners.
